result.execSummary:
The defendant Adriana Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants payment plan of $50 per month beginning January 1, 2019 and due on the first day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Attorney's fees to be applied once filed by counsel.

4/8 - Attorney fee's added per order signed 4/8.
Submit to DNA sample at Ozaukee County Sheriff's Dept.

records.addlTxt: 09:03 AM Defendant Adriana Martinez in court with attorney Shauna D. Manion.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts guilty plea and finds defendant guilty. Counsel as to sentence. Court renders sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 13, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Judge Moroney sitting for Judge Voiland. Defendant Adriana Martinez in court with attorney Shauna D. Manion.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests an adjournment of plea and sentencing to allow time for defendant to obtain valid driver's license. No objection by the State.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Letter Atty Manion RE: Adjournment  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 2 Clerk JF.
online checking account payment returned due to closed account.  Defendant has contacted us and is sending new account info.

Defendant Adriana Martinez in court with attorney Shauna D. Manion.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel still in discussions with the State. State requests 60 day adjournment.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 5, 2018 at 09:00 am.
